intro: Hieracium rubricaule, commonly known as the red-hair hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow flowers, surrounded by pale green ray florets, bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium rubricaule is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name.
